snippet: A Romanian-born American ended his 17-day hunger strike when the government, after years of inaction, agreed to open an inquiry into the beating death of his father in a prison 30 years ago.
abstract: Romanian-born American Andrei Ursu ends his 17-day hunger strike when Romania's government, after years of delay and inaction, agrees to open a new investigation into beating death of his father, a prominent dissident, in a communist-era prison three decades earlier.

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and KIT GILLET

lead_paragraph: A Romanian-born American ended his 17-day hunger strike when the government, after years of inaction, agreed to open an inquiry into the beating death of his father in a prison 30 years ago.

headline.main: Romania Hunger Strike Prompts Inquiry Into Dissident’s Death
headline.print_headline: Romania Hunger Strike Prompts Inquiry Into Dissident’s Death

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
